column2: in vanum laboravérunt qŭi aĕdìficant eam. Nisi Dòminus custodíverit civitátem
column4: qŭi custódit eam. ^ Unless the Lord build the house
column5: they labour in vain that build it. Unless the Lord keep the city
column6: he watcheth in vain that keepeth it.

column1: 2 ^ Vanum est vobîs ante lucem sùrģere
column3: qŭi manducátis panem dolóris. Qŭum dèderit diléctîs suîs sòmnum. ^ It is vain for you to rise before light
column4: rise ye after you have sat down
column5: you that eat the bread of sorrow. When he shall give sleep to his beloved.

column2: fructus vèntris. ^ Behold the inheritance of the Lord are children~; the reward
ita fílii excussórum. ^ As arrows in the hand of the mighty
column3: so the children of them that have been shaken.

column1: 5 ^ Beátus vìr qŭi implévit desidèrium suum ex ìpsîs~; non confundétur qŭum loqŭétur inimícîs suîs in porta. ^ Blessed is the man that hath filled the desire with them~; he shall not be confounded when he shall speak to his enemies in the gate.
